source.author: Carr, G.W.
source.title: Salix
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Carr, G.W. (1996). Salix. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Branches typically widely spreading to slightly pendent with age; twigs often retaining dense tomentum, green or brownish-green; leaves broadly obovate or oblanceolate; margins almost entire to strongly undulate-serrate; lamina dull green and shortly pubescent above, remaining softly pubescent below or becoming glabrescent, hairs crisped, relatively long, not rust-coloured

Branches rigidly erect; twigs becoming glabrescent, typically dark reddish-brown; leaves oblanceolate to narrowly oblong, margins weakly to strongly glandular-serrate, undulate or not; lamina lustrous dark green above and more or less glabrous except on veins, underside grey-glaucous with sparse indumentum of short crisped hairs, with a scattering (especially towards apex) of often subappressed rust-coloured hairs
